qas.question: What sort of definition can be used to conveniently encompass the complexity of diverse phenomena?
What is the broad operational definition of a gene?

answers.text: a union of genomic sequences encoding a coherent set of potentially overlapping functional products

qas.question: What does the typical definition of a gene categorize genes by?
What does the broad operational definition of gene categorize genes by?
What does the broad operational definition of a gene classify as gene-associated regions?

context: <a0_0>A broad operational definition<a0_0/> is sometimes used to encompass the complexity of these diverse phenomena, where a gene is defined as <a1_0>a union of genomic sequences encoding a coherent set of potentially overlapping functional products<a1_0/>. This definition categorizes genes by <a3_0>their functional products (proteins or RNA)<a3_0/> rather than <a2_0>their specific DNA loci<a2_0/>, with <a4_0>regulatory elements<a4_0/> classified as gene-associated regions.
